items.title: A Subway Killing Stuns, and Divides, New Yorkers
items.abstract: After a homeless man was killed on the subway, New Yorkers and elected officials are mourning his death and debating how the city should address mental health and public safety.

items.title: New York’s Difficulty in Filling Job Vacancies Has Hurt City Services
items.abstract: Of the 15 agencies with the highest worker vacancy rates, nine have failed to meet performance targets, according to the city comptroller.

items.title: Will New York City’s Soccer Stadium Cost Taxpayers $0 or $516 Million?
items.abstract: An independent budget analysis suggests that the city will be losing $516 million in tax revenue from its deal to place a new soccer stadium in Queens.

items.title: Rising Costs a Concern for Land-Lease Building Owners
items.abstract: Land-lease buildings in New York rent the ground on which they stand. With land prices soaring, unit owners in these buildings worry that their costs will rise.

items.title: In Long Island City, Now Arriving in No Man’s Land
items.abstract: For five nights, a decommissioned rail line in Queens became home to a hidden speakeasy.
